April 2015  – Present (5 months) Bellmore, New York Assist client with engineering analysis, design, and specification of Software Defined Radio. CORBA, Python. Sr. Software Engineer ICG (International Communications Group, Inc.)/Rockwell Collins (acquisition) November 2013  –  May 2015  (1 year 7 months) Newport News, VA Subcontract to Honeywell for Aspire 300 product and Boeing for 7Next product, enabling Future Air Navigation System (FANS) over IRIDIUM satellite communication. 18 month project to analyze customer requirements, develop hardware and software solution. Capture requirements in DOORS. Prepared Software analysis and design using Yourdon methodologies for Modern Structured Analysis and Object-Oriented Analysis and Design for inclusion into PDR and CDR materials for Honeywell Aspire 300 program. Coded and integrated embedded uIP web server on ARM9 microcontroller. C/C++ coding, Hardware/Software Integration, JIRA issue tracking. AS9100 quality processes. Company acquired by Rockwell Collins August 2015 for $60 million. Use of TortoiseSVN for Subversion, Python, Microsoft Visual Studio 10 (2010) and 11 (2012), Boost library, and CMake 2.8. Writing Python wrappers around Visual Studio C++ DLLs and Python scripts to access functionality across exported DLL interfaces. Heavy use of Visual Studio 2010 & 2012, modifying project properties and writing pre-build and post-build event commands to integrate test scripts into development environment file hierarchy. Object oriented analysis and design of software based on clients' requirements. Member of Software Engineering staff during ramp up of anticipated software development effort pending management approval. Sr. Software Engineer CPU Technology, Inc./Boeing Military Aircraft (acquisition) November 2011  –  September 2012  (11 months) Pleasanton, CA Develop embedded Adobe Flash Action Scripts using Adobe Flash Professional tool. Developed, maintained, and enhanced embedded GoAhead web server and other embedded software to run on Acalis CPU. Acalis provides security-on-a-chip that can help defend the manned and unmanned aircraft built at Boeing Military Aircraft today and in the future for customers around the world. Liason to Czech Republic during hardware/software integration. Used Microsoft Visual Studio and CLR/Managed code paradigm for creating GUI screens. Used MCP skills in setup /debug of server farm deployed in Czech Republic. Enabled remote access for support of servers. Track issues with Rational ClearCase. Class design/code MELPE vocoder serialization/deserialization software. Module (SAASM) team, performing software enhancement, maintenance, debug, and 
test of legacy GPS receiver software code written in C language. Corrected 
legacy software implementation of Navstar Protection Algorithm (NPA). Wrote 
Perl script system, similar to VectorCast, to parse instrumented software under 
unit test to determine execution path coverage per DO-178B requirements. Use of 
DOORs for requirements tracking. Sr. Software Engineer Rockwell Collins September 2008  –  February 2009  (6 months) Cedar Rapids, Iowa Area Senior Software Engineer performing C++ programming, code reviews, detailed algorithm analysis, DOORS requirements verification/tracing. Change request (CR) verifications on JANUS AAMP7G processor-based Common Cryptographic Sub-System (CSS) software changes. Reviewed 100K lines of code during Janus Common CSS code reviews to detect errors in logic, coding, and comments. Studied details of Analog Devices Blackfin BF-534 interrupt processing mechanism to assist in black-box and white-box testing and software integration. Software test/integration of software functionality for incremental delivery to customer. Sr. Software Engineer SafeNet March 2007  –  July 2008  (1 year 5 months) Belcamp, MD; Danvers, MA Senior Software Engineer developing test scripts in Perl for automated testing of KG-340 (Type 1 SONET Encryptor). Communicate with units under test via serial port using Windows API with serial port Perl module to send commands to configure test scenario parameters and kick off test sequence. Control of Digital Lightwave Network Information Computer using Standard Commands for Programmable Instruments (SCPI). Develop data logging scheme to enable quick post-test evaluation of status from pass/fail/errors. 
Senior Software Engineer for 3x20 and 3x40 ARM core processor based embedded encryption hardware. Worked as the senior member of team of 6-10 engineers tasked with meeting deadlines for delivery of hundreds of test cases for path coverage and test of embedded real-time software application. Developed framework for test of ARM interrupt vector processing, interrupt handler. Mentor junior S/W engineers on C language constructs; walkthroughs to correct coding errors; audit software tools used to develop test scripts; advise team on inner workings of ARM AXD features and CodeWarrior scatter files for steering compiled code to different load regions and execution regions. Became knowledgeable and assisted team members on setting up hardware and coming up to speed on project. Researched and advised on AXD semi-hosting for loading files onto target from Windows/Intel host onto target board, as well as mentoring on ARM/Thumb state interworking veneer code. Detected and isolated fabrication errors with RAM tests and knowledge of ARM Assembly language. Sr. Software Engineer Mykotronx October 2004  –  March 2007  (2 years 6 months) Torrance, CA Torrance, CA 
Senior Software Engineer for KIV-7M Type 1 COMSEC link encryption device designed to operate in Time Division Multiple Access (TDMA) architectures to provide secure high bandwidth, wide area, networked data exchange via MILSTAR satellites over a broad range of data rates. Define, design and develop system requirements and allocate them to subsystems. Develop software for MYK-185 ASIC in compliance with CMM Level 3. Senior Software Engineer/Assistant Software Design Lead for Enhanced Crypto Card (ECC) porting of Krypton ASIC cache code to MYK-185 ASIC. Documented software architecture for preliminary design review presentation to NSA. Developed firmware test drivers to exercise cache code, ROM code functionality and characterize randomizer properties for regression tests. Test Engineer for Advanced Extremely High Frequency COMSEC/TRANSEC System (ACTS); developed automated test scripts using proprietary scripting command language, to demonstrate requirements coverage/traceability. Sr. Software Engineer L-3 Communications March 2004  –  July 2004  (5 months) Camden, NJ Senior Software Engineer developing real-time embedded software in accordance 
with SEI-CMMi software development methodology for PETRA cryptographic token 
project. Worked with systems engineers to develop detailed PDL by using 
Nassi-Shneiderman diagrams and later used those to code, assess McCabe 
cyclomatic complexity, and prove path coverage to Software Quality Assurance 
witness. Used Rational ClearCase for C language program file configuration 
control/archiving. Used Microsoft C++ Developer Studio for prototyping and 
Texas Instruments’ Code Composer Studio for target code generation, debug and 
real-time analysis of embedded code execution. Sr. Software Engineer ITT Avionics November 2003  –  February 2004  (4 months) Clifton, NJ Senior Software Engineer developed documentation materials for Advanced Integrated Defensive Electronic Warfare Suite (AIDEWS) using UML and Rational Rose to show class and sequence diagrams. Sr. Software Engineer Northrop Grumman Corporation November 2002  –  December 2003  (1 year 2 months) Linthicum, MD and Rolling Meadows, IL Senior Software Engineer developing real-time embedded software for receiver on F-16 Block 60 Falcon Edge or IEWS (Integrated Electronic Warfare Suite) -- most capable fighter aircraft in the world. Hardware/Software provides significant advances in radar, electronic warfare, target acquisition and weapon accuracy. A significant capability is that it also provides the location of the threat emitter, rather than simply showing the direction the radar is coming from, to allow the pilot to attack it. Prototyped code in Microsoft C++ Developer Studio and Green Hills Software ARINC-653 compliant Integrity DO-178B RTOS for Power PC target code generation. Used Green Hills EventAnalyzer GUI debugger for real-time analysis of embedded code execution. Heavy MS Excel spreadsheet analysis to prototype algorithms and generate data for correct answer comparisons. Specification, design, code, and test of data structures and algorithms to implement receiver requirements. Kalman filters, antenna bore-sight roll-off calculations, angle of arrival from signal strength with respect to first crossover. Synergize experience from previous position to solve design problems on current project. Secret clearance for classified portions of project. Sr. Software Engineer Comptek ASD/Northrop Grumman Corporation April 2001  –  November 2002  (1 year 8 months) East Elmhurst, NY Senior Software Engineer for Advanced Multiple Emitter Simulator (AMES) program. 2-18 GHz precision RF emitter generator for simulating 2048 simultaneous threats per frame. Developed software written in Pascal in Borland Delphi visual development environment. Verify operation of high-speed lookup operations and 8-point interpolations to provide simulated threat RF waveform attenuations. Understand, design, code to create differential time-of-arrival/phase delta in waveforms from emitters in varying antenna array geometries. Redesigned/Tested 3 Tier DCOM Distributed Database. Worked with Digital engineers to develop software for custom designed XILINX hardware for Electronic Warfare simulation. Developed TCP/IP client-server application for streaming simulation data from SQL database to XILINX hardware via VME bus. Developed software to verify hardware functionality and subsystem interfaces. Sr. Software Engineer RTS Wireless/Aether Systems May 2000  –  March 2001  (11 months) Woodbury, NY Programmed in C language in Microsoft Visual Studio environment to create multi-threaded system service to provide infrastructure for wireless messaging applications. Programmed in C and C++ language to modify Windows NT Service responsible for starting, stopping, restarting mission critical multi-threaded software processes used in Wireless Internet Application Gateway. Created in-house documentation for clustering IBM Netfinity servers for high reliability/availability access to critical data. Debugged existing code to track down and fix memory leaks, unterminated/unused threads and create a more robust executable. Designed, coded, and tested new code for control of Black Box Corp DB-25 A/B switch which switched incoming phone lines in case of cluster failover from one server on a cluster to the other server. Trained as an MCSE and PSE to support Microsoft Windows NT servers and clustered IBM Netfinity servers, respectively. Software Engineer Northrop Grumman Corporation May 1998  –  February 1999  (10 months) Holbrook, NY Reverse engineered B-2 bomber system software to create C++ object oriented classes for creation of training courseware. Software Engineer Sikorsky Aircraft/Lockheed Martin (acquisition) March 1998  –  May 1998  (3 months) Trumbull, CT Modify/reverse-engineer Ada language source code for Comanche RAH-066 Helicopter Cockpit Interface Management (CIM) program. Incorporate new requirements for expanded operational capability and low-rate initial production phases of contract. Redesign/reuse/modify existing Ada source code packages. Display aircraft systems health status in real-time to pilot and co-pilot on demand. Alert crew with warnings, cautions, and advisories when aircraft parameters exceed defined limits. Respond to crew inputs to system in real-time. Adjust displays refresh frequency and phase to maximize throughput on graphics generator and minimize CPU load. Sr. Software Engineer TRW/Northrop Grumman Corporation-Space Technology Sector (acquisition) May 1997  –  March 1998  (11 months) Redondo Beach, CA Designed, coded, tested, integrated, and delivered proprietary real-time data recording/analysis system (QUICK-LOOK) for field test/debug of Tactical High Energy Laser (THEL) system. Allows users to evaluate system's ability to acquire, track, and destroy ballistic missiles from ground and air based platforms. QUICK-LOOK tool now being used on ABL system for same purpose. Designed, coded, tested, integrated simulators to model Beam Alignment Subsystem Controller, Pointer/Tracker Subsystem Controller, and Beam Director Assembly Controller messaging protocols. Programmed in LabWindows/CVI to design user interface for data entry/control of simulator scenarios allowing user to define message formats with initial values, select increment periods and increment values. Coded in C language on 200 MHz Pentium PC with Windows NT 4.0 operating system. Member of integration team modeling interfaces pending delivery and test/checkout of subcontracted hardware and software subsystems. Acted as on-site representative for TRW at Ball Corp. and at Contraves-Brashear Corp., performing sub-system integration prior to deliveries. Software Engineer McDonnell Douglas Aircraft/Boeing (acquisition) July 1995  –  May 1997  (1 year 11 months) Greater St. Louis Area Wrote GUI in LabWindows/CVI for Hardware-In-The-Loop weapon simulator for GPS guided munition tailkit "JDAM". Liason to Northrop Grumman for integration of JDAM on B2 bomber. Worked in B2 lab in Pico Rivera, CA, recording MIL-1553 bus communication messages, monitored telemetry at Mission Contol building at Edwards Air Force base during flight test. Computer Programmer All-Source Processing Inc. November 1993  –  April 1994  (6 months) Parsippany, NJ Created and maintained database of LANDSAT satellite imagery of the entire Earth for Special Operations Forces Advanced Mission Planning System (SOFAMPS) in Microsoft Access. Created Advanced Digital Raster Imagery (ADRI) image tiles of Earth's surface with pixel Latitude/Longitude resolution accurate to 5 meters. Design, code, test device driver to control/interface 5 Gigabyte capacity 8mm magnetic tape drive hardware over Small Computer System Interface (SCSI) using Adaptec Host Adapter under DOS (ASPI software layer). Corrected erroneous magnetic variation(MAGVAR) algorithm based on personal knowledge of navigation. Implemented SODANO's Very Long Geodesics Equations for high precision distance/course computations. Debugged 80386 Assembly language module responsible for managing multiple radio frequency emitters (friend/foe) in real-time used to upload to JSTARS/MATT total battlefield management system. Software Engineer Beckman Coulter May 1992  –  May 1993  (1 year 1 month) Hialeah, FL Designed/coded Graphical user Interface (GUI) for hematology (blood analysis) equipment using Vermont Views. Programmed algorithms in C, C++, and Pascal to implement blood component classification and analysis. Created templates in SOFTCODE/Screen Sculptor to generate flexible user interfaces. Programmed Object-Oriented printer routines in C++ language to allow rapid integration of new printers and customized report formats with minimal software impact. Software Engineer Olympus February 1991  –  February 1992  (1 year 1 month) New Hyde Park, NY Designed, coded, and tested Windows 3.0 data-collection application for optical spectral photometer (OSP-100). Allowed acquisition/display of digital multi-spectral data collected, via IEEE-488 (GPIB) bus, from state-of-the-art linear diode array sensor with diffraction grating coupled to very-low-light microscope lens aperture. Developed prototype system using Borland Object Windows Library (OWL). Designed and coded algorithms in C++, Pascal for Windows. Reverse-engineered medical imaging database software for use with Olympus endoscopic images. Interfaced 3 1/2 inch floptical disk drive hardware to SCSI bus under DOS. Software Engineer Honeywell/Sperry Commercial Flight Systems Group June 1988  –  June 1990  (2 years 1 month) Phoenix, Arizona Area Coded, tested, and integrated DO-178B compliant avionics software for Airbus A-320 Flight Management System Software within A-320 and A-340 Systems Group. Computers used were VAX Clustered 86xx, 88xx, and Sperry PC/XT in EtherNet LAN. Extensive programming in Pascal on VAX and Turbo-Pascal 4.0 on PC/XT. Created Software Integration Testbed (simulation environment) on VAX to allow software testing without hardware testbeds. Designed and implemented automated generation of I/O variable lists and module hierarchies for deliverable documentation. Co-designed and developed Automated Testing Routine (ATR) to facilitate customer testing and acceptance of software. Tested software modules using ATR. Implemented VAX Simulator system routines allowing multi-programming context switches to run very large simulations. Obtained expert knowledge of Honeywell Pascal compiler, linker, and collector internals. Reviewed entire source code for Flight Management user interface consisting of over 50 display screens and complex input methodologies. Defined and documented ARINC-429 I/O to Flight Guidance computer for A-340 project. Software Engineer Eaton AIL/EDO February 1987  –  March 1988  (1 year 2 months) Edwards Air Force Base, CA Developed software to support evaluation of B1-B Defensive Avionics System (ALQ-161) undergoing flight tests at the Air Force Flight Test Center. Computers used were VAX 11/750, VAX 8530, and IBM-PC/XT/AT. Programmed in VAX FORTRAN, F-77, and Pascal in UNIX operating system environment. Created, maintained and documented programs which read recorded real-time flight test data created by on-board instrumentation. Updated performance data base, generated plots and analyzed Defensive Avionics Systems performance. Software Engineer Eaton Corporation - Command Systems Division/Telephonics Corporation May 1985  –  January 1987  (1 year 9 months) Farmingdale, NY Designed, programmed, documented and coded real-time software, in accordance with MIL-STD-1679 software development standards, for an all-Digital Consolidated Very Low Frequency communications receiver (CVLF) for the Navy. Computers used were Data General Nova, Eclipse MV/4000, VAX 11/730, and Fairchild FS-1. Programmed in CMS-2, F-77, and VAX FORTRAN languages in UNIX operating system environment. Worked extensively with linker to map code segments according to ROM memory-mapping scheme. Acted as liaison between Eaton Corp. compiler users and 4-C Corp. (producers of CMS-2 compiler). Computer Scientist Image Technology Corp. June 1984  –  May 1985  (1 year) Deer Park, NY Programmed coded, tested, and documented real-time application software for microcomputer based Machine Vision/Image Analysis systems used for biological colony-counters, parts inspection, and other go/no-go decisions. Debugged, maintained, and enhanced existing Machine Vision/Image Analysis application. Wrote software in BASIC, Pascal, and Z80 assembler in CP/M and DOS operating systems. Computers used were: IBM PC/XT, AT&T 6300, Apple 2e, IEEE-696 (S-100 bus single board computer).

Summary A flair for UNIX software system design has lead to a 30 year track record of : 
 
- speeding up existing software (often between five to forty times) 
- creating self-repairing systems

Airbus, Nokia, Orange, Barclays, BT, BT Mobile, Reuters, UPS, Zurich Financial Services, Andersen Consulting, Bull, SEL, Eagle Star Experience Senior Software Engineer Airbus 2011  – Present (4 years) Bristol, United Kingdom UNIX (HP-UX and Linux), OO PERL, PERL TK, KORN SHELL, PYTHON, LSF, FORTRAN, MVS, VAX 
 
Designed and built a multi-user dynamic parallel processing system for the in-house FLAGLIS tool (which runs large parallelizable multi-day jobs) whereby : 
 
Jobs can run up to 10x faster. 
Jobs automatically scale dynamically between 1 to N threads at run-time depending on thread availability. 
At any given time the available system resource is used to maximum effect and shared between the current jobs. 
Generic design allows the system to be used elsewhere. 
 
Migrated 50 years worth of UK Flight Physics data and codes from an IBM mainframe to Linux : 
 
Copied 4 million files (approx. 10 terabytes) from nearline IBM mainframe storage to linux by developing a multi-threaded python ftp and unix shell script system. 
Ran 8 threads 24/7 for approx. 1 year. 
Iterative process with the code capturing hundreds of thousands of errors which had to be addressed and re-processed. 
Developed batch solutions for the conversion of 1 million binary files using 5 different methods (some running on the IBM mainframe, some on an HPUX server). 
Developed a data and metadata archive system on linux to house this data, with both GUI and command line interfaces, allowing users to find files, view metadata and extract files from the archive. 
 
Migrated 50 years worth of UK Flight Physics data and codes from a VAX system to HP-UX. 
 
FLAGLIS (in-house) tool decommissioning and archiving task : 
 
Ran approx. 1.5 million program steps using FLAGLIS (on HPUX), validated the output data and archived it to Linux.  
By tweaking FLAGLIS and creating an integrated archive process I was able to largely automate this process and speed up the task by a few months. Summary After my education at the Royal Dutch Navy to become a Navigation Officer, I soon discovered that I had a real passion for software development. 
 
In 1997 I joined an outsourcing company named VXCompany and started my career as a software engineer. 
In 1999 I started at n-store and worked on custom multimedia solutions and web applications for customers in the retail business.  
These software solutions are still in production today and drive most part of n-store’s business. 
 
I started my own contracting company March 2007 and I am working as a freelance software engineer on web- and windows applications, with a strong focus on C# .Net, the Microsoft platform and recently Umbraco. 
 
I have a lot of experience in software development projects on the Microsoft platform. I often worked on the entire process from analysis to implementation and construction for these projects, using ASP.NET (MVC / Webforms), WPF, WCF, Webservices, Unity, Entity Framework and MS Sql Server. 
Next to that I have used Silverlight,WPF and Adobe Flash / Flex in projects for which a rich user interface was needed. Specialties:C#, .Net 4.0, ASP.NET, ASP.NET MVC, Entity Framework, WPF ,WCF, Visual Studio, TFS, MS SQL Server, Windows Server, Windows 7, Silverlight, Agile, Umbraco, Test Driven Development Summary After my education at the Royal Dutch Navy to become a Navigation Officer, I soon discovered that I had a real passion for software development.
